alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Martin and northeastern Pike Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Varney, or 10 miles northeast of Pikeville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Heisey around 435 PM EDT. Sidney, Canada, Conder and Rural around 440 PM EDT. Turkey Creek, Huddy, Mcandrews and Whitepost around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Forest Hills, Belfry and Hardy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
